intro: Henriettea maroniensis, commonly known as the Maroni Henriettea, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of western Central Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Henriettea maroniensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments within dense forest canopies. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
